intro: Cereus tacuarembensis, commonly known as the Tacuarembé cactus, is a species native to Brazil. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its spiny, ribbed stems and ability to store water efficiently. The plant produces large, night-blooming flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-draining soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in desert gardens and botanical collections.
